intro: Eschweilera correae, commonly known as the Guianese rosewood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Lecythidaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark wood that is highly valued for its strength and beauty. The tree typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and elliptical in shape, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its rarity and slow growth, Eschweilera correae is considered an endangered species, making it a focus of conservation efforts.
